pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess module¶

pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.add_child_ip_scope(startIp, endIp, name, description, scopeid, auth, url)[source]¶

Function takes input of four strings Start Ip, endIp, name, and description to add new Ip Scope to terminal access in the HPE IMC base platform

Parameters:
  • startIp – str Start of IP address scope ex. ‘10.101.0.1’
  • endIp – str End of IP address scope ex. ‘10.101.0.254’
  • name – str Name of the owner of this IP scope ex. ‘admin’
  • description – str description of the Ip scope
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

200
Return type:

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> add_child_ip_scope('10.50.0.1', '10.50.0.126', 'cyoung', 'test sub scope', '175', auth.creds, auth.url)
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.add_host_to_segment(ipaddress, name, description, network_address, auth, url)[source]¶

Function to abstract existing add_scope_ip_function. Allows for use of network address rather than forcing human to learn the scope_id :param ipaddress:

Parameters:
  • name – name of the owner of this host
  • description – Description of the host
Param:

network_address: network address of the target scope in format x.x.x.x/yy where x.x.x.x representents the

network address and yy represents the length of the subnet mask. Example: 10.50.0.0 255.255.255.0 would be written as 10.50.0.0/24

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:
Return type:
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.add_ip_scope(startIp, endIp, name, description, auth, url)[source]¶

Function takes input of four strings Start Ip, endIp, name, and description to add new Ip Scope to terminal access in the HPE IMC base platform

Parameters:
  • startIp – str Start of IP address scope ex. ‘10.101.0.1’
  • endIp – str End of IP address scope ex. ‘10.101.0.254’
  • name – str Name of the owner of this IP scope ex. ‘admin’
  • description – str description of the Ip scope
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

200 if successfull
Return type:

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> delete_ip_scope('10.50.0.0/24', auth.creds, auth.url)
<Response [204]>

>>> new_scope = add_ip_scope('10.50.0.1', '10.50.0.254', 'cyoung', 'test group', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(new_scope) is int

>>> assert new_scope == 200

>>> existing_scope = add_ip_scope('10.50.0.1', '10.50.0.254', 'cyoung', 'test group', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(existing_scope) is int

>>> assert existing_scope == 409
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.add_scope_ip(ipaddress, name, description, scopeid, auth, url)[source]¶

Function to add new host IP address allocation to existing scope ID

Parameters:
  • ipaddress –
  • name – name of the owner of this host
  • description – Description of the host
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:
Return type:

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> new_host = add_scope_ip('10.50.0.5', 'cyoung', 'New Test Host','175', auth.creds, auth.url)
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.delete_host_from_segment(ipaddress, networkaddress, auth, url)[source]¶

Function to abstract

pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.delete_ip_scope(network_address, auth, url)[source]¶

Function to delete an entire IP segment from the IMC IP Address management under terminal access :param network_address :param auth :param url

>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> new_scope = add_ip_scope('10.50.0.1', '10.50.0.254', 'cyoung', 'test group', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> delete_scope = delete_ip_scope('10.50.0.0/24', auth.creds, auth.url)
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.get_host_id(host_address, network_address, auth, url)[source]¶
Parameters:host – str describing network address of the target scope in format x.x.x.x where x.x.x.x representents the

full ipv4 address. Example: 10.50.0.5 255.255.255.0 would be written as 10.50.0.5

Parameters:network_address – network address of the target scope in format x.x.x.x/yy where x.x.x.x representents the

network address and yy represents the length of the subnet mask. Example: 10.50.0.0 255.255.255.0 would be written as 10.50.0.0/24

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

str object which contains the numerical ID of the target scope
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> new_scope = add_ip_scope('10.50.0.1', '10.50.0.254', 'cyoung', 'test group', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> add_host_to_segment('10.50.0.5', 'cyoung', 'New Test Host', '10.50.0.0/24', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> new_host_id = get_host_id('10.50.0.5', '10.50.0.0/24', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(new_host_id) is str
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.get_ip_mac_arp_list(devId, auth, url)[source]¶

function takes devid of specific device and issues a RESTFUL call to get the IP/MAC/ARP list from the target device.

Parameters:
  • devId – int or str value of the target device.
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

list of dictionaries containing the IP/MAC/ARP list of the target device.
Return type:

list

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> ip_mac_list = get_ip_mac_arp_list('10', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(ip_mac_list) is list

>>> assert 'deviceId' in ip_mac_list[0]
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.get_ip_scope(auth, url, scopeId=None)[source]¶

function requires no inputs and returns all IP address scopes currently configured on the HPE IMC server. If the optional scopeId parameter is included, this will automatically return only the desired scope id.

Parameters:
  • scopeId – integer of the desired scope id ( optional )
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

list of dictionary objects where each element of the list represents one IP scope
Return type:

list

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> ip_scope_list = get_ip_scope(auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(ip_scope_list) is list

>>> assert 'ip' in ip_scope_list[0]
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.get_ip_scope_detail(scopeId, auth, url)[source]¶

function requires no inputs and returns all IP address scopes currently configured on the HPE IMC server. If the optional scopeId parameter is included, this will automatically return only the desired scope id. :param scopeId: integer of the desired scope id ( optional )

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

dictionary, may containing multiple entries if sub-scopes have been created
Return type:

dict

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> ip_scope_detail = get_ip_scope_detail('45', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(ip_scope_detail) is dict

>>> assert 'startIp' in ip_scope_detail
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.get_ip_scope_hosts(scopeId, auth, url)[source]¶

Function requires input of scope ID and returns list of allocated IP address for the specified scope

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
  • scopeId – Interger of teh desired scope id
Returns:

list of dictionary objects where each element of the list represents a single host assigned to the IP scope
Return type:

list

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> scope_id = get_scope_id('10.50.0.0/24', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> ip_scope_hosts = get_ip_scope_hosts(scope_id, auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(ip_scope_hosts) is list

>>> assert 'name' in ip_scope_hosts[0]

>>> assert 'description' in ip_scope_hosts[0]

>>> assert 'ip' in ip_scope_hosts[0]

>>> assert 'id' in ip_scope_hosts[0]
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.get_real_time_locate(ipAddress, auth, url)[source]¶

function takes the ipAddress of a specific host and issues a RESTFUL call to get the device and interface that the target host is currently connected to. Note: Although intended to return a single location, Multiple locations may be returned for a single host due to a partially discovered network or misconfigured environment.

Parameters:
  • ipAddress – str value valid IPv4 IP address
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

list of dictionaries where each element of the list represents the location of the target host
Return type:

list

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> found_device = get_real_time_locate('10.101.0.51', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(found_device) is list

>>> assert 'deviceId' in found_device[0]

>>> assert 'deviceId' in found_device[0]

>>> assert 'deviceId' in found_device[0]

>>> assert 'deviceId' in found_device[0]

>>> no_device = get_real_time_locate('192.168.254.254', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(no_device) is dict

>>> assert len(no_device) == 0
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.get_scope_id(network_address, auth, url)[source]¶
Parameters:network_address – network address of the target scope in format x.x.x.x/yy where x.x.x.x representents the

network address and yy represents the length of the subnet mask. Example: 10.50.0.0 255.255.255.0 would be written as 10.50.0.0/24

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

str object which contains the numerical ID of the target scope
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> new_scope = add_ip_scope('10.50.0.1', '10.50.0.254', 'cyoung', 'test group', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> scope_id = get_scope_id('10.50.0.0/24', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(scope_id) is str
pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess.remove_scope_ip(hostid, auth, url)[source]¶

Function to add remove IP address allocation

Parameters:
  • hostid – Host id of the host to be deleted
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

String of HTTP response code. Should be 204 is successfull
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.termaccess import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> new_scope = add_ip_scope('10.50.0.1', '10.50.0.254', 'cyoung', 'test group', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> add_host_to_segment('10.50.0.5', 'cyoung', 'New Test Host', '10.50.0.0/24', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> host_id = get_host_id('10.50.0.5', '10.50.0.0/24', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> rem_host = remove_scope_ip(host_id, auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(rem_host) is int

>>> assert rem_host == 204
